summary.para: Retrieves the and input string that represents a chunk of data.

param.name: pFirstPos
param.para: Receives the zero-based starting position of the range. This parameter can be NULL.

param.name: pLength
param.para: Receives the length of the range. This parameter can be NULL.

param.name: ppsz
param.para: Receives the associated Unicode string value, or NULL if not available.

param.name: pValue
param.para: Receives the associated value, or VT_EMPTY if not available. This parameter can be NULL.

returns.para: If this method succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

remarks.para: Prior to Windows 7, this was declared in structuredquery.idl and structuredquery.h.

summary.para: Represents a chunk of data as a string and a value.

remarks.para: In Windows 7, this interface is defined in structuredquerycondition.idl and structuredquerycondition.h. Prior to Windows 7 this interface was declared in structuredquery.h and structuredquery.idl.
